intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. alpestris, commonly known as Alpine cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. The leaves are pinnately divided, with a fern-like appearance, and the plant is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
